courseDescription: The spreadsheet has become one of the most widely used analytical tools in the modern world.  This course introduces students to the use of spreadsheet (e.g., MS Excel).  Topics include: formulas, functions, sorting and filtering, and pivot tables.   Besides the spreadsheet capabilities, the course will cover spreadsheet applications in the supply chain, logistics and maritime industry.
Technical and Digital Skills: Sorting and filtering data in spreadsheets
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Applying spreadsheet applications in supply chain management
Applying spreadsheet applications in the maritime industry

courseDescription: This course introduces students to the intersections between maritime leadership, technology, and society. It will explain the important elements of the marine transportation and technological systems, which consist of waterways and ports that allow for various modes of transportation to move people and goods to, from, and on the water. Specific topics include an introduction to different types of cargo, how cargo is moved, ship types, ship equipment, ship routes, basic navigation and ship stability, emerging industries including offshore wind and autonomous systems, maritime law, maritime safety, and leadership.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of different types of cargo and how it is moved
Awareness of emerging maritime industries such as offshore wind and autonomous systems
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze different types of cargo and corresponding transportation methods
Knowledge of ship routes and ability to determine optimal routes

courseDescription: This course examines strategic, tactical and operational issues in the planning and control of manufacturing and service delivery operations in an increasingly globalized world. This course examines such topics as process design, capacity, materials planning and control, inventory decisions, location and layout, quality and scheduling.

The course examines international logistics and terms for movement of goods and analyzes how companies enter into foreign markets and participate in international trade. It discusses processes and concepts involved in domestic and international multimodal transportation. It also covers operational issues such as payment, commercial documents, insurance, and customs.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of insurance in international trade
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with foreign market participants
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Solving operational issues in international trade
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organization of payment processes in international trade

courseDescription: The course includes an overview of the key elements of multimodal freight transportation.  It examines modes of transportation, transportation economics, and transportation technology, as well as costing and pricing for transportation. The relationships between intermediaries (including third party-logistics companies), carriers, and shippers are discussed.  It also provides an overview for transportation risk, transportation software as well as issues on global logistics.
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Effective communication with intermediaries, carriers, and shippers
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Management of relationships between intermediaries, carriers, and shippers

courseDescription: The logistics activities are increasingly global and are influenced by a system of national and international laws. This complex industry requires an understanding of the regulations and legislation for freight transportation flows. This course will cover domestic and international supply contracts for freight cargo, Incoterms, international law of the sea, maritime jurisdiction, regulation of shipping, carriage of goods, cargo and marine insurance, salvage, marine environmental law, safety at sea, along with other relevant transportation laws.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of national and international laws
Understanding of cargo and marine insurance
Knowledge of safety at sea regulations
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Ability to communicate legal and regulatory terms
Clarifying legal discrepancies in freight transportation
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluation and application of regulations and legislation
Problem-solving in the context of salvage
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading and coordinating in a regulated environment

courseDescription: This course covers the operation of assets related to maritime transportation, including seaports, vessels fleets in the movement of cargo domestic and international cargo. It presents concepts related to organization and operation of ports. It discusses issues involved in planning, investment, communication systems, congestion, pollution, safety, security; intermodal transportation; water and land accessibility; and port competition and cooperation. Examines freight shipping organizations operations. Topics include vessel fleet, shipping markets, operations, costs, insurance, and regulations; and ship types, safety, role of the flag state, pollution, chartering and purchase, and understanding of the shipbuilding and ship repair market.
Technical and Digital Skills: Knowledge of shipbuilding and ship repair market
Understanding of maritime insurance and regulations
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Planning and investment in maritime operations
Addressing issues of congestion and pollution
Ensuring safety and security in maritime operations
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Chartering and purchase in maritime operations

courseTitle: Maritime and Supply Chain Safety and Security
courseDescription: This course examines methods to anticipate threats and mitigation strategies for securing the supply chain and increasing its resilience.  It provides an overview of international and U.S initiatives to ensure the security of logistics assets, cargo, people, and infrastructure within the maritime and supply chain domain. The course also addresses threats to the international trade (including maritime piracy, terrorism, cyber threats), and state-of-the-art techniques and tools for protecting the industry against cyberattacks, as well as roles and responsibilities of the supply chain actors.
Technical and Digital Skills: Risk assessment for supply chain and maritime operations
Understanding of international and U.S. security initiatives
Techniques and tools for protecting against cyberattacks
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Communication of security risks and mitigation strategies
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Anticipation of threats to supply chain and maritime operations
Development of mitigation strategies for security risks
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Management of logistics assets, cargo, people, and infrastructure

courseTitle: Maritime and Supply Chain Risk and Insurance
courseDescription: This course examines the risks associated with supply chain operations, including aspects of identification, analysis, assessment, response, and control of the risks associated with the transportation and storage of goods.  It covers risk assessment as a function of threats, vulnerabilities, and consequences for operational performance for all modes of transportation.  Topics include Lloyd's and the London Insurance Market, principles of insurance and law, international liability conventions, institute clauses, exclusions, cargo policies, particular and general average, and salvage insurance.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of insurance principles and law
Understanding of institute clauses, exclusions, and cargo policies
Understanding of particular and general average
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Coordinating with various modes of transportation
Managing insurance policies for supply chain operations

courseDescription: An overview of the strategic sourcing of materials and services in the organization and its role in the supply chain. Topics include sourcing decisions, price/cost analysis, quality issues, purchasing, supplier selection, legal and ethical issues, third party logistics, freight forwarding, and acquisition of services and capital assets. This course also covers supply and procurement negotiations. It examines conceptual and practical skills in negotiations.  Students will develop analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills, with an emphasis placed on experiential learning through case studies and role playing.
Technical and Digital Skills: Strategic sourcing of materials and services
Understanding of legal and ethical issues in sourcing
Knowledge of third party logistics and freight forwarding
Acquisition of services and capital assets
Interpersonal and Communication Skills: Role playing to simulate real-world negotiation scenarios
Effective interpersonal skills in a business context
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Organizational skills in managing procurement and supply processes

courseTitle: Maritime and Supply Chain Execution and Analytics
courseDescription: This course examines the performance metrics of the supply chain, including item tracking and visibility of the whole chain, including control tower approaches.  It covers the importance of supply chain information collection, real-time data sharing and basic analytics tools to evaluate and improve the degree of execution of the supply chain and generating insights. Topics include monitoring supply chain processes, end-to-end visibility, collaborative supply chain networks, data integration, and data visualization.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Evaluating and improving supply chain execution
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Implementing control tower approaches for item tracking

courseDescription: This course examines the environmental impact of supply chain activities, including environmental measurements and strategies to achieve carbon neutrality.  Topics include green network distribution, sustainable sourcing operations, and circular supply chains.
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Analysis of supply chain environmental impact
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Strategic planning for circular supply chains

courseTitle: Advanced Maritime and Supply Chain Technology
courseDescription: This course examines the role of technology within the supply chain and how these technologies can be used to improve supply chain performance.  Topics include AI, blockchain and smart contracts, IoT and digital twins, Large Language models (LLM), automation and robotics, digital supply chain transformation, machine learning in supply chain, anti-hacking technologies, autonomous vehicles, and additive manufacturing, among others.
Technical and Digital Skills: Understanding of AI in supply chain
Problem-Solving and Analytical Skills: Applying machine learning to solve supply chain problems
Organizational and Leadership Skills: Leading digital transformation in supply chains
Planning and implementing new technologies in supply chains
